meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inaccurate.
meanings.sent1: Her report contained an inaccuracy that needed correction.
meanings.sent2: The inaccuracy of the map led us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent3: The inaccuracy in the weather forecast made everyone bring umbrellas on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The inaccuracy in his statement was like a broken compass, pointing us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: The inaccuracy of his memory was evident when he couldn't recall the correct date.

meanings.sent1: The inaccuracy in the calculation resulted in the wrong answer.
meanings.sent2: She admitted her inaccuracy in interpreting the instructions.
meanings.sent3: The chef's inaccuracy in measuring the ingredients turned the cake into a pancake.
meanings.sent4: His inaccuracy in judgment was like a blindfold leading him astray.
meanings.sent5: The inaccuracy of the clock caused him to miss his appointment.
